intro: Halimocnemis gamocarpa, commonly known as the African star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, star-shaped white flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has strap-like, evergreen leaves that are often used in ornamental gardening. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens or containers. Halimocnemis gamocarpa is also valued for its ability to thrive in arid conditions, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments.
